subcommands.name: loki
subcommands.description: Dump logs from Loki api.

context.description: The name of the kubeconfig context to use

days.description: Limit maximum number of days in range to output per queue from Loki. (Default 5 maximum number of days in range per queue.)

end.description: Set end timestamp range to dump logs from Loki. (Default get max end timestamp from Loki, ex. "2025-01-14 15:04:05".)

kubeconfig.description: KubeConfig of the cluster. (default is $KUBECONFIG when it is set, $HOME/.kube/config otherwise)

limit.description: Limit the number of lines to output per queue from Loki. (Default 5000 max limit strings per queue.)

start.description: Set start timestamp range to dump logs from Loki. (Default get max start timestamp from Loki, ex. "2025-01-12 15:04:05".)

subcommands.name: delivery-kit
subcommands.description: A set of tools for building, distributing, and deploying containerized applications

subcommands.name: build [IMAGE_NAME...]
subcommands.description: Build images

add-custom-tag.description:
Set tag alias for the content-based tag.
The alias may contain the following shortcuts:
- %image%, %image_slug% or %image_safe_slug% to use the image name (necessary if there is more than one image in the werf config);
- %image_content_based_tag% to use a content-based tag.
For cleaning custom tags and associated content-based tag are treated as one.
Also can be defined with $WERF_ADD_CUSTOM_TAG_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_CUSTOM_TAG_1="%image%-tag1", $WERF_ADD_CUSTOM_TAG_2="%image%-tag2")

allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage.description: Set allowed percentage of docker storage volume usage which will cause cleanup of least recently used local docker images (default 70% or $WERF_ALLOWED_DOCKER_STORAGE_VOLUME_USAGE)

allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-marg.description: During cleanup of least recently used local docker images werf would delete images until volume usage becomes below "allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage - allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-margin" level (default 5% or $WERF_ALLOWED_DOCKER_STORAGE_VOLUME_USAGE_MARGIN)

allowed-local-cache-volume-usage.description: Set allowed percentage of local cache (~/.werf/local_cache by default) volume usage which will cause cleanup of least recently used data from the local cache (default 70% or $WERF_ALLOWED_LOCAL_CACHE_VOLUME_USAGE)

allowed-local-cache-volume-usage-margin.description: During cleanup of least recently used local docker images werf would delete images until volume usage becomes below "allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage - allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-margin" level (default 5% or $WERF_ALLOWED_LOCAL_CACHE_VOLUME_USAGE_MARGIN)

build-report-path.description: Change build report path and format (by default $WERF_BUILD_REPORT_PATH or ".werf-build-report.json" if not set). Extension must be either .json for JSON format or .env for env-file format. If extension not specified, then .json is used

cache-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple cache repos with images that will be used as a cache. Cache will be populated when pushing newly built images into the primary repo and when pulling existing images from the primary repo. Cache repo will be used to pull images and to get manifests before making requests to the primary repo.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_CACHE_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_CACHE_REPO_1=..., $WERF_CACHE_REPO_2=...)

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

dev.description:
Enable development mode (default $WERF_DEV).
The mode allows working with project files without doing redundant commits during debugging and development

dev-branch.description: Set dev git branch name (default $WERF_DEV_BRANCH or "_werf-dev")

dev-ignore.description:
Add rules to ignore tracked and untracked changes in development mode (can specify multiple).
Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

disable-auto-host-cleanup.description: Disable auto host cleanup procedure in main werf commands like werf-build, werf-converge and other (default disabled or WERF_DISABLE_AUTO_HOST_CLEANUP)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read, pull and push images into the specified repo, to pull base images

docker-server-storage-path.description: Use specified path to the local docker server storage to check docker storage volume usage while performing garbage collection of local docker images (detect local docker server storage path by default or use $WERF_DOCKER_SERVER_STORAGE_PATH)

final-repo-container-registry.description:
Choose final-repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_FINAL_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

follow.description:
Enable follow mode (default $WERF_FOLLOW).
The mode allows restarting the command on a new commit.
In development mode (--dev), werf restarts the command on any changes (including untracked files) in the git repository worktree

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the .helm/Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

introspect-before-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the clean state, before running all assembly instructions of the stage

introspect-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the state, right after running failed assembly instruction

introspect-stage.description:
Introspect a specific stage. The option can be used multiple times to introspect several stages.

There are the following formats to use:
* specify IMAGE_NAME/STAGE_NAME to introspect stage STAGE_NAME of either image or artifact IMAGE_NAME
* specify STAGE_NAME or */STAGE_NAME for the introspection of all existing stages with name STAGE_NAME

IMAGE_NAME is the name of an image or artifact described in werf.yaml, the nameless image specified with ~.
STAGE_NAME should be one of the following: from, beforeInstall, dependenciesBeforeInstall, gitArchive, install, dependenciesAfterInstall, beforeSetup, dependenciesBeforeSetup, setup, dependenciesAfterSetup, gitCache, gitLatestPatch, dockerInstructions, dockerfile

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

parallel-tasks-limit.description: Parallel tasks limit, set -1 to remove the limitation (default $WERF_PARALLEL_TASKS_LIMIT or 5)

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

save-build-report.description: Save build report (by default $WERF_SAVE_BUILD_REPORT or false). Its path and format configured with --build-report-path

secondary-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple secondary read-only repos with images that will be used as a cache.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_1=..., $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_2=...)

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

synchronization.description:
Address of synchronizer for multiple werf processes to work with a single repo.

Default:
 - $WERF_SYNCHRONIZATION, or
 - :local if --repo is not specified, or
 - https://delivery-sync.deckhouse.ru if --repo has been specified.

The same address should be specified for all werf processes that work with a single repo. :local address allows execution of werf processes from a single host only

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

virtual-merge.description: Enable virtual/ephemeral merge commit mode when building current application state ($WERF_VIRTUAL_MERGE by default)

subcommands.name: bundle
subcommands.description: Work with werf bundles: publish bundles into container registry and deploy bundles into Kubernetes cluster

subcommands.name: apply
subcommands.description: Apply bundle into Kubernetes

add-annotation.description:
Add annotation to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: annoName=annoValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_1=annoName1=annoValue1, $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_2=annoName2=annoValue2)

add-label.description:
Add label to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: labelName=labelValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_LABEL_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_LABEL_1=labelName1=labelValue1, $WERF_ADD_LABEL_2=labelName2=labelValue2)

atomic.description: Enable auto rollback of the failed release to the previous deployed release version when current deploy process have failed ($WERF_ATOMIC by default)

auto-rollback.description: Enable auto rollback of the failed release to the previous deployed release version when current deploy process have failed ($WERF_AUTO_ROLLBACK by default)

deploy-graph-path.description: Save deploy graph path to the specified file (by default $WERF_DEPLOY_GRAPH_PATH). Extension must be .dot or not specified. If extension not specified, then .dot is used

deploy-report-path.description: Change deploy report path and format (by default $WERF_DEPLOY_REPORT_PATH or ".werf-deploy-report.json" if not set). Extension must be .json for JSON format. If extension not specified, then .json is used

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read, pull and push images into the specified repo, to pull base images

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

hooks-status-progress-period.description: Hooks status progress period in seconds. Set 0 to stop showing hooks status progress. Defaults to $WERF_HOOKS_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or status progress period value

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

namespace.description: Use specified Kubernetes namespace (default $WERF_NAMESPACE)

releases-history-max.description: Max releases to keep in release storage ($WERF_RELEASES_HISTORY_MAX or 5 by default)

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

rollback-graph-path.description: Save rollback graph path to the specified file (by default $WERF_ROLLBACK_GRAPH_PATH). Extension must be .dot or not specified. If extension not specified, then .dot is used

save-deploy-report.description: Save deploy report (by default $WERF_SAVE_DEPLOY_REPORT or false). Its path and format configured with --deploy-report-path

secret-values.description: Specify helm secret values in a YAML file (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_ENV=secret_values_test.yaml, $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_DB=secret_values_db.yaml)

set.description:
Set helm values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_2=key2=val2)

set-docker-config-json-value.description: Shortcut to set current docker config into the .Values.dockerconfigjson

set-file.description:
Set values from respective files specified via the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_FILE_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_FILE_1=key1=path1, $WERF_SET_FILE_2=key2=val2)

set-string.description:
Set STRING helm values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_STRING_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_STRING_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_STRING_2=key2=val2)

skip-dependencies-repo-refresh.description: Do not refresh helm chart repositories locally cached index

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

status-progress-period.description: Status progress period in seconds. Set -1 to stop showing status progress. Defaults to $WERF_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or 5 seconds

tag.description: Provide exact tag version or semver-based pattern, werf will install or upgrade to the latest version of the specified bundle ($WERF_TAG or latest by default)

timeout.description: Resources tracking timeout in seconds ($WERF_TIMEOUT by default)

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

values.description: Specify helm values in a YAML file or a URL (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_VALUES_1=values_1.yaml, $WERF_VALUES_2=values_2.yaml)

subcommands.name: copy
subcommands.description: Copy published bundle into another location

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read, pull and push images into the specified repos

from.description: Source address of the bundle to copy, specify bundle archive using schema `archive:PATH_TO_ARCHIVE.tar.gz`, specify remote bundle with schema `[docker://]REPO:TAG` or without schema.

helm-compatible-chart.description: Set chart name in the Chart.yaml of the published chart to the last path component of container registry repo (for REGISTRY/PATH/TO/REPO address chart name will be REPO, more info https://helm.sh/docs/topics/registries/#oci-feature-deprecation-and-behavior-changes-with-v370). In helm compatibility mode chart is fully conforming with the helm OCI registry requirements. Default true or $WERF_HELM_COMPATIBLE_CHART.

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

rename-chart.description: Force setting of chart name in the Chart.yaml of the published chart to the specified value (can be set by the $WERF_RENAME_CHART, no rename by default, could not be used together with the '--helm-compatible-chart' option).

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

to.description: Destination address of the bundle to copy, specify bundle archive using schema `archive:PATH_TO_ARCHIVE.tar.gz`, specify remote bundle with schema `[docker://]REPO:TAG` or without schema.

Choose final-repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_FINAL_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

helm-compatible-chart.description: Set chart name in the Chart.yaml of the published chart to the last path component of container registry repo (for REGISTRY/PATH/TO/REPO address chart name will be REPO, more info https://helm.sh/docs/topics/registries/#oci-feature-deprecation-and-behavior-changes-with-v370). In helm compatibility mode chart is fully conforming with the helm OCI registry requirements. Default false or $WERF_HELM_COMPATIBLE_CHART.

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the .helm/Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

introspect-before-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the clean state, before running all assembly instructions of the stage

introspect-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the state, right after running failed assembly instruction

introspect-stage.description:
Introspect a specific stage. The option can be used multiple times to introspect several stages.

There are the following formats to use:
* specify IMAGE_NAME/STAGE_NAME to introspect stage STAGE_NAME of either image or artifact IMAGE_NAME
* specify STAGE_NAME or */STAGE_NAME for the introspection of all existing stages with name STAGE_NAME

IMAGE_NAME is the name of an image or artifact described in werf.yaml, the nameless image specified with ~.
STAGE_NAME should be one of the following: from, beforeInstall, dependenciesBeforeInstall, gitArchive, install, dependenciesAfterInstall, beforeSetup, dependenciesBeforeSetup, setup, dependenciesAfterSetup, gitCache, gitLatestPatch, dockerInstructions, dockerfile

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

parallel-tasks-limit.description: Parallel tasks limit, set -1 to remove the limitation (default $WERF_PARALLEL_TASKS_LIMIT or 5)

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

rename-chart.description: Force setting of chart name in the Chart.yaml of the published chart to the specified value (can be set by the $WERF_RENAME_CHART, no rename by default, could not be used together with the '--helm-compatible-chart' option).

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

require-built-images.description: Requires all used images to be previously built and exist in repo. Exits with error if needed images are not cached and so require to run build instructions (default $WERF_REQUIRE_BUILT_IMAGES)

save-build-report.description: Save build report (by default $WERF_SAVE_BUILD_REPORT or false). Its path and format configured with --build-report-path

secondary-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple secondary read-only repos with images that will be used as a cache.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_1=..., $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_2=...)

secret-values.description: Specify helm secret values in a YAML file (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_ENV=.helm/secret_values_test.yaml, $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_DB=.helm/secret_values_db.yaml)

set.description:
Set helm values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_2=key2=val2)

set-file.description:
Set values from respective files specified via the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_FILE_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_FILE_1=key1=path1, $WERF_SET_FILE_2=key2=val2)

set-string.description:
Set STRING helm values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_STRING_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_STRING_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_STRING_2=key2=val2)

skip-dependencies-repo-refresh.description: Do not refresh helm chart repositories locally cached index

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

synchronization.description:
Address of synchronizer for multiple werf processes to work with a single repo.

Default:
 - $WERF_SYNCHRONIZATION, or
 - :local if --repo is not specified, or
 - https://delivery-sync.deckhouse.ru if --repo has been specified.

The same address should be specified for all werf processes that work with a single repo. :local address allows execution of werf processes from a single host only

tag.description: Publish bundle into container registry repo by the provided tag ($WERF_TAG or latest by default)

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

use-custom-tag.description:
Use a tag alias in helm templates instead of an image content-based tag (NOT RECOMMENDED).
The alias may contain the following shortcuts:
- %image%, %image_slug% or %image_safe_slug% to use the image name (necessary if there is more than one image in the werf config);
- %image_content_based_tag% to use a content-based tag.
For cleaning custom tags and associated content-based tag are treated as one.
Also, can be defined with $WERF_USE_CUSTOM_TAG (e.g. $WERF_USE_CUSTOM_TAG="%image%-tag")

values.description: Specify helm values in a YAML file or a URL (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_VALUES_1=.helm/values_1.yaml, $WERF_VALUES_2=.helm/values_2.yaml)

virtual-merge.description: Enable virtual/ephemeral merge commit mode when building current application state ($WERF_VIRTUAL_MERGE by default)

without-images.description: Disable building of images defined in the werf.yaml (if any) and usage of such images in the .helm/templates ($WERF_WITHOUT_IMAGES or false by default — e.g. enable all images defined in the werf.yaml by default)

subcommands.name: render
subcommands.description: Render Kubernetes manifests from bundle

add-annotation.description:
Add annotation to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: annoName=annoValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_1=annoName1=annoValue1, $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_2=annoName2=annoValue2)

add-label.description:
Add label to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: labelName=labelValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_LABEL_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_LABEL_1=labelName1=labelValue1, $WERF_ADD_LABEL_2=labelName2=labelValue2)

bundle-dir.description: Get extracted bundle from directory instead of registry (default $WERF_BUNDLE_DIR)

disable-default-secret-values.description: Do not use secret values from the default .helm/secret-values.yaml file (default $WERF_DISABLE_DEFAULT_SECRET_VALUES or false)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read, pull and push images into the specified repo, to pull base images

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

include-crds.description: Include CRDs in the templated output (default $WERF_INCLUDE_CRDS)

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:

Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

namespace.description: Use specified Kubernetes namespace (default $WERF_NAMESPACE)

output.description: Write render output to the specified file instead of stdout ($WERF_RENDER_OUTPUT by default)

repo-container-registry.description:

The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

set-docker-config-json-value.description: Shortcut to set current docker config into the .Values.dockerconfigjson

set-string.description:

Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_STRING_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_STRING_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_STRING_2=key2=val2)

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

tag.description: Provide exact tag version or semver-based pattern, werf will render the latest version of the specified bundle ($WERF_TAG or latest by default)

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

validate.description: Validate your manifests against the Kubernetes cluster you are currently pointing at (default $WERF_VALIDATE)

values.description: Specify helm values in a YAML file or a URL (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_VALUES_1=values_1.yaml, $WERF_VALUES_2=values_2.yaml)

subcommands.name: ci-env CI_SYSTEM
subcommands.description: Generate werf environment variables for specified CI system

as-env-file.description: Create the .env file and print the path for sourcing (default $WERF_AS_ENV_FILE).

as-file.description: Create the script and print the path for sourcing (default $WERF_AS_FILE).

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

dev.description:
Enable development mode (default $WERF_DEV).
The mode allows working with project files without doing redundant commits during debugging and development

dev-branch.description: Set dev git branch name (default $WERF_DEV_BRANCH or "_werf-dev")

dev-ignore.description:
Add rules to ignore tracked and untracked changes in development mode (can specify multiple).
Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command will copy specified or default (~/.docker) config to the temporary directory and may perform additional login with new config.

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

log-terminal-width.description:

* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

login-to-registry.description: Log in to CI-specific registry automatically if possible (default $WERF_LOGIN_TO_REGISTRY).

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

shell.description: Set to cmdexe, powershell or use the default behaviour that is compatible with any unix shell (default $WERF_SHELL).

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

subcommands.name: cleanup
subcommands.description: Cleanup project images in the container registry

allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage.description: Set allowed percentage of docker storage volume usage which will cause cleanup of least recently used local docker images (default 70% or $WERF_ALLOWED_DOCKER_STORAGE_VOLUME_USAGE)

allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-marg.description: During cleanup of least recently used local docker images werf would delete images until volume usage becomes below "allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage - allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-margin" level (default 5% or $WERF_ALLOWED_DOCKER_STORAGE_VOLUME_USAGE_MARGIN)

allowed-local-cache-volume-usage.description: Set allowed percentage of local cache (~/.werf/local_cache by default) volume usage which will cause cleanup of least recently used data from the local cache (default 70% or $WERF_ALLOWED_LOCAL_CACHE_VOLUME_USAGE)

allowed-local-cache-volume-usage-margin.description: During cleanup of least recently used local docker images werf would delete images until volume usage becomes below "allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage - allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-margin" level (default 5% or $WERF_ALLOWED_LOCAL_CACHE_VOLUME_USAGE_MARGIN)

cache-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple cache repos with images that will be used as a cache. Cache will be populated when pushing newly built images into the primary repo and when pulling existing images from the primary repo. Cache repo will be used to pull images and to get manifests before making requests to the primary repo.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_CACHE_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_CACHE_REPO_1=..., $WERF_CACHE_REPO_2=...)

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

dev.description:
Enable development mode (default $WERF_DEV).
The mode allows working with project files without doing redundant commits during debugging and development

dev-branch.description: Set dev git branch name (default $WERF_DEV_BRANCH or "_werf-dev")

dev-ignore.description:
Add rules to ignore tracked and untracked changes in development mode (can specify multiple).
Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

disable-auto-host-cleanup.description: Disable auto host cleanup procedure in main werf commands like werf-build, werf-converge and other (default disabled or WERF_DISABLE_AUTO_HOST_CLEANUP)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read, pull and delete images from the specified repo

docker-server-storage-path.description: Use specified path to the local docker server storage to check docker storage volume usage while performing garbage collection of local docker images (detect local docker server storage path by default or use $WERF_DOCKER_SERVER_STORAGE_PATH)

dry-run.description: Indicate what the command would do without actually doing that (default $WERF_DRY_RUN)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List image and artifact names defined in werf.yaml.

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

subcommands.description: Render werf.yaml.

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

subcommands.name: converge
subcommands.description: Build and push images, then deploy application into Kubernetes

add-annotation.description:
Add annotation to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: annoName=annoValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_1=annoName1=annoValue1, $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_2=annoName2=annoValue2)

add-custom-tag.description:
Set tag alias for the content-based tag.
The alias may contain the following shortcuts:
- %image%, %image_slug% or %image_safe_slug% to use the image name (necessary if there is more than one image in the werf config);
- %image_content_based_tag% to use a content-based tag.
For cleaning custom tags and associated content-based tag are treated as one.
Also can be defined with $WERF_ADD_CUSTOM_TAG_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_CUSTOM_TAG_1="%image%-tag1", $WERF_ADD_CUSTOM_TAG_2="%image%-tag2")

add-label.description:
Add label to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: labelName=labelValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_LABEL_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_LABEL_1=labelName1=labelValue1, $WERF_ADD_LABEL_2=labelName2=labelValue2)

allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage.description: Set allowed percentage of docker storage volume usage which will cause cleanup of least recently used local docker images (default 70% or $WERF_ALLOWED_DOCKER_STORAGE_VOLUME_USAGE)

allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-marg.description: During cleanup of least recently used local docker images werf would delete images until volume usage becomes below "allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage - allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-margin" level (default 5% or $WERF_ALLOWED_DOCKER_STORAGE_VOLUME_USAGE_MARGIN)

allowed-local-cache-volume-usage.description: Set allowed percentage of local cache (~/.werf/local_cache by default) volume usage which will cause cleanup of least recently used data from the local cache (default 70% or $WERF_ALLOWED_LOCAL_CACHE_VOLUME_USAGE)

allowed-local-cache-volume-usage-margin.description: During cleanup of least recently used local docker images werf would delete images until volume usage becomes below "allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage - allowed-docker-storage-volume-usage-margin" level (default 5% or $WERF_ALLOWED_LOCAL_CACHE_VOLUME_USAGE_MARGIN)

atomic.description: Enable auto rollback of the failed release to the previous deployed release version when current deploy process have failed ($WERF_ATOMIC by default)

auto-rollback.description: Enable auto rollback of the failed release to the previous deployed release version when current deploy process have failed ($WERF_AUTO_ROLLBACK by default)

build-report-path.description: Change build report path and format (by default $WERF_BUILD_REPORT_PATH or ".werf-build-report.json" if not set). Extension must be either .json for JSON format or .env for env-file format. If extension not specified, then .json is used

cache-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple cache repos with images that will be used as a cache. Cache will be populated when pushing newly built images into the primary repo and when pulling existing images from the primary repo. Cache repo will be used to pull images and to get manifests before making requests to the primary repo.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_CACHE_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_CACHE_REPO_1=..., $WERF_CACHE_REPO_2=...)

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

deploy-graph-path.description: Save deploy graph path to the specified file (by default $WERF_DEPLOY_GRAPH_PATH). Extension must be .dot or not specified. If extension not specified, then .dot is used

deploy-report-path.description: Change deploy report path and format (by default $WERF_DEPLOY_REPORT_PATH or ".werf-deploy-report.json" if not set). Extension must be .json for JSON format. If extension not specified, then .json is used

dev.description:
Enable development mode (default $WERF_DEV).
The mode allows working with project files without doing redundant commits during debugging and development

dev-branch.description: Set dev git branch name (default $WERF_DEV_BRANCH or "_werf-dev")

dev-ignore.description:
Add rules to ignore tracked and untracked changes in development mode (can specify multiple).
Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

disable-auto-host-cleanup.description: Disable auto host cleanup procedure in main werf commands like werf-build, werf-converge and other (default disabled or WERF_DISABLE_AUTO_HOST_CLEANUP)

disable-default-secret-values.description: Do not use secret values from the default .helm/secret-values.yaml file (default $WERF_DISABLE_DEFAULT_SECRET_VALUES or false)

disable-default-values.description: Do not use values from the default .helm/values.yaml file (default $WERF_DISABLE_DEFAULT_VALUES or false)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read, pull and push images into the specified repo, to pull base images

docker-server-storage-path.description: Use specified path to the local docker server storage to check docker storage volume usage while performing garbage collection of local docker images (detect local docker server storage path by default or use $WERF_DOCKER_SERVER_STORAGE_PATH)

final-repo-container-registry.description:
Choose final-repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_FINAL_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

follow.description:
Enable follow mode (default $WERF_FOLLOW).
The mode allows restarting the command on a new commit.
In development mode (--dev), werf restarts the command on any changes (including untracked files) in the git repository worktree

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

hooks-status-progress-period.description: Hooks status progress period in seconds. Set 0 to stop showing hooks status progress. Defaults to $WERF_HOOKS_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or status progress period value

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the .helm/Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

introspect-before-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the clean state, before running all assembly instructions of the stage

introspect-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the state, right after running failed assembly instruction

introspect-stage.description:
Introspect a specific stage. The option can be used multiple times to introspect several stages.

There are the following formats to use:
* specify IMAGE_NAME/STAGE_NAME to introspect stage STAGE_NAME of either image or artifact IMAGE_NAME
* specify STAGE_NAME or */STAGE_NAME for the introspection of all existing stages with name STAGE_NAME

IMAGE_NAME is the name of an image or artifact described in werf.yaml, the nameless image specified with ~.
STAGE_NAME should be one of the following: from, beforeInstall, dependenciesBeforeInstall, gitArchive, install, dependenciesAfterInstall, beforeSetup, dependenciesBeforeSetup, setup, dependenciesAfterSetup, gitCache, gitLatestPatch, dockerInstructions, dockerfile

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

namespace.description: Use specified Kubernetes namespace (default [[ project ]]-[[ env ]] template or deploy.namespace custom template from werf.yaml or $WERF_NAMESPACE)

parallel-tasks-limit.description: Parallel tasks limit, set -1 to remove the limitation (default $WERF_PARALLEL_TASKS_LIMIT or 5)

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

release.description: Use specified Helm release name (default [[ project ]]-[[ env ]] template or deploy.helmRelease custom template from werf.yaml or $WERF_RELEASE)

releases-history-max.description: Max releases to keep in release storage ($WERF_RELEASES_HISTORY_MAX or 5 by default)

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

require-built-images.description: Requires all used images to be previously built and exist in repo. Exits with error if needed images are not cached and so require to run build instructions (default $WERF_REQUIRE_BUILT_IMAGES)

rollback-graph-path.description: Save rollback graph path to the specified file (by default $WERF_ROLLBACK_GRAPH_PATH). Extension must be .dot or not specified. If extension not specified, then .dot is used

save-build-report.description: Save build report (by default $WERF_SAVE_BUILD_REPORT or false). Its path and format configured with --build-report-path

save-deploy-report.description: Save deploy report (by default $WERF_SAVE_DEPLOY_REPORT or false). Its path and format configured with --deploy-report-path

secondary-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple secondary read-only repos with images that will be used as a cache.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_1=..., $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_2=...)

secret-values.description: Specify helm secret values in a YAML file (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_ENV=.helm/secret_values_test.yaml, $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_DB=.helm/secret_values_db.yaml)

set.description:
Set helm values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_2=key2=val2)

set-docker-config-json-value.description: Shortcut to set current docker config into the .Values.dockerconfigjson

set-file.description:
Set values from respective files specified via the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_FILE_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_FILE_1=key1=path1, $WERF_SET_FILE_2=key2=val2)

set-string.description:
Set STRING helm values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).
Also, can be defined with $WERF_SET_STRING_* (e.g. $WERF_SET_STRING_1=key1=val1, $WERF_SET_STRING_2=key2=val2)

skip-dependencies-repo-refresh.description: Do not refresh helm chart repositories locally cached index

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

status-progress-period.description: Status progress period in seconds. Set -1 to stop showing status progress. Defaults to $WERF_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or 5 seconds

synchronization.description:
Address of synchronizer for multiple werf processes to work with a single repo.

Default:
 - $WERF_SYNCHRONIZATION, or
 - :local if --repo is not specified, or
 - https://delivery-sync.deckhouse.ru if --repo has been specified.

The same address should be specified for all werf processes that work with a single repo. :local address allows execution of werf processes from a single host only

timeout.description: Resources tracking timeout in seconds ($WERF_TIMEOUT by default)

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

use-custom-tag.description:
Use a tag alias in helm templates instead of an image content-based tag (NOT RECOMMENDED).
The alias may contain the following shortcuts:
- %image%, %image_slug% or %image_safe_slug% to use the image name (necessary if there is more than one image in the werf config);
- %image_content_based_tag% to use a content-based tag.
For cleaning custom tags and associated content-based tag are treated as one.
Also, can be defined with $WERF_USE_CUSTOM_TAG (e.g. $WERF_USE_CUSTOM_TAG="%image%-tag")

values.description: Specify helm values in a YAML file or a URL (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_VALUES_1=.helm/values_1.yaml, $WERF_VALUES_2=.helm/values_2.yaml)

virtual-merge.description: Enable virtual/ephemeral merge commit mode when building current application state ($WERF_VIRTUAL_MERGE by default)

subcommands.name: cr
subcommands.description: Work with container registry: authenticate, list and remove images, etc.

subcommands.name: login registry
subcommands.description: Login into remote registry.

docker-config.description: Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

password.description: Use specified password for login (default $WERF_PASSWORD)

password-stdin.description: Read password from stdin for login (default $WERF_PASSWORD_STDIN)

username.description: Use specified username for login (default $WERF_USERNAME)

subcommands.name: logout registry
subcommands.description: Logout from a remote registry.

subcommands.name: dismiss
subcommands.description: Delete werf release from Kubernetes

* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

namespace.description: Use specified Kubernetes namespace (default [[ project ]]-[[ env ]] template or deploy.namespace custom template from werf.yaml or $WERF_NAMESPACE)

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

release.description: Use specified Helm release name (default [[ project ]]-[[ env ]] template or deploy.helmRelease custom template from werf.yaml or $WERF_RELEASE)

releases-history-max.description: Max releases to keep in release storage ($WERF_RELEASES_HISTORY_MAX or 5 by default)

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

secondary-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple secondary read-only repos with images that will be used as a cache.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_1=..., $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_2=...)

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

status-progress-period.description: Status progress period in seconds. Set -1 to stop showing status progress. Defaults to $WERF_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or 5 seconds

synchronization.description:
Address of synchronizer for multiple werf processes to work with a single repo.

Default:
 - $WERF_SYNCHRONIZATION, or
 - :local if --repo is not specified, or
 - https://delivery-sync.deckhouse.ru if --repo has been specified.

The same address should be specified for all werf processes that work with a single repo. :local address allows execution of werf processes from a single host only

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

use-deploy-report.description: Use deploy report, previously saved with --save-deploy-report (by default $WERF_USE_DEPLOY_REPORT or false). Its path and format configured with --deploy-report-path

with-hooks.description: Delete Helm Release hooks getting from existing revisions (default $WERF_WITH_HOOKS or true)

with-namespace.description: Delete Kubernetes Namespace after purging Helm Release (default $WERF_WITH_NAMESPACE)

subcommands.name: export [IMAGE_NAME...] [options]
subcommands.description: Export images

add-label.description:
Add label to exported images (can specify multiple).
Format: labelName=labelValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_EXPORT_ADD_LABEL_* (e.g. $WERF_EXPORT_ADD_LABEL_1=labelName1=labelValue1, $WERF_EXPORT_ADD_LABEL_2=labelName2=labelValue2)

cache-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple cache repos with images that will be used as a cache. Cache will be populated when pushing newly built images into the primary repo and when pulling existing images from the primary repo. Cache repo will be used to pull images and to get manifests before making requests to the primary repo.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_CACHE_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_CACHE_REPO_1=..., $WERF_CACHE_REPO_2=...)

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

dev.description:
Enable development mode (default $WERF_DEV).
The mode allows working with project files without doing redundant commits during debugging and development

dev-branch.description: Set dev git branch name (default $WERF_DEV_BRANCH or "_werf-dev")

dev-ignore.description:
Add rules to ignore tracked and untracked changes in development mode (can specify multiple).
Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read and pull images from the specified repo

dry-run.description: Indicate what the command would do without actually doing that (default $WERF_DRY_RUN)

final-repo-container-registry.description:
Choose final-repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_FINAL_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

insecure-helm-dependencies.description: Allow insecure oci registries to be used in the .helm/Chart.yaml dependencies configuration (default $WERF_INSECURE_HELM_DEPENDENCIES)

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

introspect-before-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the clean state, before running all assembly instructions of the stage

introspect-error.description: Introspect failed stage in the state, right after running failed assembly instruction

introspect-stage.description:
Introspect a specific stage. The option can be used multiple times to introspect several stages.

There are the following formats to use:
* specify IMAGE_NAME/STAGE_NAME to introspect stage STAGE_NAME of either image or artifact IMAGE_NAME
* specify STAGE_NAME or */STAGE_NAME for the introspection of all existing stages with name STAGE_NAME

IMAGE_NAME is the name of an image or artifact described in werf.yaml, the nameless image specified with ~.
STAGE_NAME should be one of the following: from, beforeInstall, dependenciesBeforeInstall, gitArchive, install, dependenciesAfterInstall, beforeSetup, dependenciesBeforeSetup, setup, dependenciesAfterSetup, gitCache, gitLatestPatch, dockerInstructions, dockerfile

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

parallel-tasks-limit.description: Parallel tasks limit, set -1 to remove the limitation (default $WERF_PARALLEL_TASKS_LIMIT or 5)

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

require-built-images.description: Requires all used images to be previously built and exist in repo. Exits with error if needed images are not cached and so require to run build instructions (default $WERF_REQUIRE_BUILT_IMAGES)

secondary-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple secondary read-only repos with images that will be used as a cache.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_1=..., $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_2=...)

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

synchronization.description:
Address of synchronizer for multiple werf processes to work with a single repo.

Default:
 - $WERF_SYNCHRONIZATION, or
 - :local if --repo is not specified, or
 - https://delivery-sync.deckhouse.ru if --repo has been specified.

The same address should be specified for all werf processes that work with a single repo. :local address allows execution of werf processes from a single host only

tag.description:
Set a tag template (can specify multiple).
It is necessary to use image name shortcut %image% or %image_slug% if multiple images are exported (e.g. REPO:TAG-%image% or REPO-%image%:TAG)

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

virtual-merge.description: Enable virtual/ephemeral merge commit mode when building current application state ($WERF_VIRTUAL_MERGE by default)

log-color-mode.description:

Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-terminal-width.description:

* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

subcommands.description: Get service values yaml generated by werf for helm chart during deploy

cache-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple cache repos with images that will be used as a cache. Cache will be populated when pushing newly built images into the primary repo and when pulling existing images from the primary repo. Cache repo will be used to pull images and to get manifests before making requests to the primary repo.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_CACHE_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_CACHE_REPO_1=..., $WERF_CACHE_REPO_2=...)

config.description: Use custom configuration file (default $WERF_CONFIG or werf.yaml in working directory)

config-templates-dir.description: Custom configuration templates directory (default $WERF_CONFIG_TEMPLATES_DIR or .werf in working directory)

dev.description:
Enable development mode (default $WERF_DEV).
The mode allows working with project files without doing redundant commits during debugging and development

dev-branch.description: Set dev git branch name (default $WERF_DEV_BRANCH or "_werf-dev")

dev-ignore.description:
Add rules to ignore tracked and untracked changes in development mode (can specify multiple).
Also, can be specified with $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_* (e.g. $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_TESTS=*_test.go, $WERF_DEV_IGNORE_DOCS=path/to/docs)

dir.description: Use specified project directory where project’s werf.yaml and other configuration files should reside (default $WERF_DIR or current working directory)

docker-config.description:
Specify docker config directory path. Default $WERF_DOCKER_CONFIG or $DOCKER_CONFIG or ~/.docker (in the order of priority)
Command needs granted permissions to read and pull images from the specified repo

final-repo-container-registry.description:
Choose final-repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_FINAL_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

git-work-tree.description: Use specified git work tree dir (default $WERF_WORK_TREE or lookup for directory that contains .git in the current or parent directories)

giterminism-config.description: Custom path to the giterminism configuration file relative to working directory (default $WERF_GITERMINISM_CONFIG or werf-giterminism.yaml in working directory)

home-dir.description: Use specified dir to store werf cache files and dirs (default $WERF_HOME or ~/.werf)

hooks-status-progress-period.description: Hooks status progress period in seconds. Set 0 to stop showing hooks status progress. Defaults to $WERF_HOOKS_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or status progress period value

insecure-registry.description: Use plain HTTP requests when accessing a registry (default $WERF_INSECURE_REGISTRY)

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:

Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

namespace.description: Use specified Kubernetes namespace (default [[ project ]]-[[ env ]] template or deploy.namespace custom template from werf.yaml or $WERF_NAMESPACE)

platform.description: Enable platform emulation when building images with werf, format: OS/ARCH[/VARIANT] ($WERF_PLATFORM or $DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM by default)

repo-container-registry.description:
Choose repo container registry implementation.
The following container registries are supported: ecr, acr, default, dockerhub, gcr, github, gitlab, harbor, quay.
Default $WERF_REPO_CONTAINER_REGISTRY or auto mode (detect container registry by repo address).

secondary-repo.description:
Specify one or multiple secondary read-only repos with images that will be used as a cache.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_* (e.g. $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_1=..., $WERF_SECONDARY_REPO_2=...)

skip-tls-verify-registry.description: Skip TLS certificate validation when accessing a registry (default $WERF_SKIP_TLS_VERIFY_REGISTRY)

status-progress-period.description: Status progress period in seconds. Set -1 to stop showing status progress. Defaults to $WERF_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or 5 seconds

stub-tags.description: Use stubs instead of real tags (default $WERF_STUB_TAGS)

synchronization.description:
Address of synchronizer for multiple werf processes to work with a single repo.

Default:
 - $WERF_SYNCHRONIZATION, or
 - :local if --repo is not specified, or
 - https://delivery-sync.deckhouse.ru if --repo has been specified.

The same address should be specified for all werf processes that work with a single repo. :local address allows execution of werf processes from a single host only

tmp-dir.description: Use specified dir to store tmp files and dirs (default $WERF_TMP_DIR or system tmp dir)

use-custom-tag.description:
Use a tag alias in helm templates instead of an image content-based tag (NOT RECOMMENDED).
The alias may contain the following shortcuts:
- %image%, %image_slug% or %image_safe_slug% to use the image name (necessary if there is more than one image in the werf config);
- %image_content_based_tag% to use a content-based tag.
For cleaning custom tags and associated content-based tag are treated as one.
Also, can be defined with $WERF_USE_CUSTOM_TAG (e.g. $WERF_USE_CUSTOM_TAG="%image%-tag")

virtual-merge.description: Enable virtual/ephemeral merge commit mode when building current application state ($WERF_VIRTUAL_MERGE by default)

without-images.description: Disable building of images defined in the werf.yaml (if any) and usage of such images in the .helm/templates ($WERF_WITHOUT_IMAGES or false by default — e.g. enable all images defined in the werf.yaml by default)

subcommands.name: install [NAME] [CHART]
subcommands.description: install a chart

add-annotation.description:
Add annotation to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: annoName=annoValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_1=annoName1=annoValue1, $WERF_ADD_ANNOTATION_2=annoName2=annoValue2)

add-label.description:
Add label to deploying resources (can specify multiple).
Format: labelName=labelValue.
Also, can be specified with $WERF_ADD_LABEL_* (e.g. $WERF_ADD_LABEL_1=labelName1=labelValue1, $WERF_ADD_LABEL_2=labelName2=labelValue2)

atomic.description: if set, the installation process deletes the installation on failure. The --wait flag will be set automatically if --atomic is used

ca-file.description: verify certificates of HTTPS-enabled servers using this CA bundle

cert-file.description: identify HTTPS client using this SSL certificate file

cleanup-on-fail.description: allow deletion of new resources created in this installation when install fails

create-namespace.description: create the release namespace if not present

dependency-update.description: update dependencies if they are missing before installing the chart

deploy-report-path.description: save deploy report in JSON to the specified path

devel.description: use development versions, too. Equivalent to version '>0.0.0-0'. If --version is set, this is ignored

disable-openapi-validation.description: if set, the installation process will not validate rendered templates against the Kubernetes OpenAPI Schema

dry-run.description: simulate an install. If --dry-run is set with no option being specified or as '--dry-run=client', it will not attempt cluster connections. Setting '--dry-run=server' allows attempting cluster connections.

enable-dns.description: enable DNS lookups when rendering templates

force.description: force resource updates through a replacement strategy

generate-name.description: generate the name (and omit the NAME parameter)

hooks-status-progress-period.description: Hooks status progress period in seconds. Set 0 to stop showing hooks status progress. Defaults to $WERF_HOOKS_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or status progress period value

insecure-skip-tls-verify.description: skip tls certificate checks for the chart download

key-file.description: identify HTTPS client using this SSL key file

keyring.description: location of public keys used for verification

kube-config.description: Kubernetes config file path (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG, or $WERF_KUBECONFIG, or $KUBECONFIG)

kube-config-base64.description: Kubernetes config data as base64 string (default $WERF_KUBE_CONFIG_BASE64 or $WERF_KUBECONFIG_BASE64 or $KUBECONFIG_BASE64)

labels.description: Labels that would be added to release metadata. Should be divided by comma.

log-color-mode.description:
Set log color mode.
Supported on, off and auto (based on the stdout’s file descriptor referring to a terminal) modes.
Default $WERF_LOG_COLOR_MODE or auto mode.

log-pretty.description: Enable emojis, auto line wrapping and log process border (default $WERF_LOG_PRETTY or true).

log-terminal-width.description:
Set log terminal width.
Defaults to:
* $WERF_LOG_TERMINAL_WIDTH
* interactive terminal width or 140

log-time.description: Add time to log entries for precise event time tracking (default $WERF_LOG_TIME or false).

log-time-format.description: Specify custom log time format (default $WERF_LOG_TIME_FORMAT or RFC3339 format).

name-template.description: specify template used to name the release

namespace.description: namespace scope for this request

no-hooks.description: prevent hooks from running during install

output.description: prints the output in the specified format. Allowed values: table, json, yaml

password.description: chart repository password where to locate the requested chart

plain-http.description: use insecure HTTP connections for the chart download

post-renderer.description: the path to an executable to be used for post rendering. If it exists in $PATH, the binary will be used, otherwise it will try to look for the executable at the given path

post-renderer-args.description: an argument to the post-renderer (can specify multiple)

render-subchart-notes.description: if set, render subchart notes along with the parent

replace.description: re-use the given name, only if that name is a deleted release which remains in the history. This is unsafe in production

repo.description: chart repository url where to locate the requested chart

secret-values.description: Specify helm secret values in a YAML file (can specify multiple). Also, can be defined with $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_* (e.g. $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_ENV=.helm/secret_values_test.yaml, $WERF_SECRET_VALUES_DB=.helm/secret_values_db.yaml)

set.description: set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2)

set-file.description: set values from respective files specified via the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2)

set-json.description: set JSON values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=jsonval1,key2=jsonval2)

set-literal.description: set a literal STRING value on the command line

set-string.description: set STRING values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2)

skip-crds.description: if set, no CRDs will be installed. By default, CRDs are installed if not already present

status-progress-period.description: Status progress period in seconds. Set -1 to stop showing status progress. Defaults to $WERF_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or 5 seconds

timeout.description: time to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks)

username.description: chart repository username where to locate the requested chart

values.description: specify values in a YAML file or a URL (can specify multiple)

verify.description: verify the package before using it

version.description: specify a version constraint for the chart version to use. This constraint can be a specific tag (e.g. 1.1.1) or it may reference a valid range (e.g. ^2.0.0). If this is not specified, the latest version is used

wait.description: if set, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, Services, and minimum number of Pods of a Deployment, StatefulSet, or ReplicaSet are in a ready state before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as --timeout

wait-for-jobs.description: if set and --wait enabled, will wait until all Jobs have been completed before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as --timeout

no-headers.description: don't print headers when using the default output format

output.description: prints the output in the specified format. Allowed values: table, json, yaml

selector.description: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2). Works only for secret(default) and configmap storage backends.

status-progress-period.description: Status progress period in seconds. Set -1 to stop showing status progress. Defaults to $WERF_STATUS_PROGRESS_PERIOD_SECONDS or 5 seconds

time-format.description: format time using golang time formatter. Example: --time-format "2006-01-02 15:04:05Z0700"
